name: Bang Bang Chicken
author: Slimming World
ingredients:
- 2 tbsp smooth peanut butter
- 3 tbsp soy sauce
- finely grated zest and juice of 1 lime
- 2 large red chillies, deseeded and finely chopped
- 150g fresh bean sprouts, rinsed
- 2 lare carrots, peeled and julienned
- 1 large (150g) courgette, spiralised or julienned
- 1 red pepper, deseeded and julienned
- 1 cucumber, julienned
- 4 spring onions, julienned
- 6 skinless boneless chicken thighs, 4 breasts, or leftovers of a roast chicken
- 2 tbsp chopped fresh coriander
instructions:
- If using chicken thighs/breast, pan fry until cooked through and set aside to cool

- Put the peanut butter, soy sauce, lime zest and juice, chillies and 100ml boiling water into a saucepan over low heat and cook until smooth, stirring occasionally. Remove from the heat, season to taste and allow to cool.
- Stir fry the bean sprouts in a little oil for 1-2 minutes.
- Shred the chicken.
- In a large bowl, toss together the carrots, courgette, red pepper, cucumber, spring onions, chicken, bean sprouts and coriander until well combined.
- Serve, and spoon the sauce on top.
